常見問題：

AC米蘭同國際米蘭又係有"米蘭"，應該點分？
ANS：AC米蘭簡稱米蘭，國際米蘭叫國米，避免稱呼做AC，因為AC係球會咁解，而milan先係名既簡稱。

AC米蘭仲係咪「老人院」？
ANS：現時全隊平均年齡為25歲。

今個轉會窗到目前為止簽咗咁多球員，遲啲仲會唔會有錢買人？
ANS：其實買球員好少會一炮過畀，多數都係分期，所以仲會有錢簽其他球員。

簽咗咁多球員會唔會過唔到FFP？
ANS：早前米蘭管理層有同UEFA探討經營計劃。
http://sempremilan.com/ts-fassone-meets-uefa-to-discuss-ac-milan-business-plan（By 二石四鳥）

Montella to Sevilla imminently

Sevilla are expected to announce Vincenzo Montella as their new Coach in the next 24 hours, as Milan release him from his contract.

The tactician was only fired on November 27 to make way for Gennaro Gattuso, but is still under contract until June 2019.

According to multiple reports, the Rossoneri will agree to terminate the deal by mutual consent so he can sign for the Liga club.

His contract with Sevilla is expected to run until June 2019 and he should have former Sevilla midfielder – and fellow Italian – Enzo Maresca as his assistant manager.

Sevilla sacked Eduardo Berizzo a few days before Christmas, just a week after he had returned to work from cancer surgery.

Although Walter Mazzarri was also interviewed for the role, the Spaniards decided Montella would be best suited to their style of football.

The 43-year-old started his management career at Roma, promoted from the youth academy as caretaker in February 2011.

He went on to Catania, Fiorentina, Sampdoria and spent just over a year at Milan.

Walcott offers himself to Milan?

The Corriere dello Sport newspaper claims Arsenal and England forward Theo Walcott offered himself to Milan for a January transfer.

The 28-year-old is under contract to June 2019 and has been with the Gunners since January 2006.

His playing time has been very limited this season, making only four substitute appearances in the Premier League, nonetheless contributing four goals and five assists in 13 competitive games.

It’s reported he is concerned that he’ll lose his spot in the England squad going to the 2018 World Cup this summer.

Southampton are the most likely candidates for a return to the club where he grew up, but Milan could be an interesting alternative.

West Ham United, Everton and Newcastle United are also options to take Walcott on loan for the rest of the season.

Cagliari President Tommaso Giulini felt it “incredible” they weren’t awarded a penalty against Juventus. “If they want a League where the big clubs always win…”

The 1-0 home defeat was decided by two incidents, as Federico Bernardeschi scored when Leonardo Pavoletti was down following an elbow in the face by Medhi Benatia.

Moments later, Bernardeschi charged down a Simone Padoin cross with his arm, but the referee did not view it himself on VAR, only communicating with the officials in the booth via an earpiece.

“Unfortunately, I was unable to work out why they didn’t check it. We are gambling for our lives in games like this, it already happened in Rome and we are good only to a degree,” the President told Mediaset Premium.

“If people want a competitive league, it’s one thing, but if they want a league where all the big clubs always win, then they should tell us.

“It’s incredible such a thing wasn’t viewed again on the VAR. Incredible. It’s just as bad as the Dries Mertens handball against Crotone.

“Bernardeschi was already booked, so he would likely have been sent off too for that handball. We would’ve been content if the referee had at least gone over to view the VAR himself. I want it explained to me how this VAR system works.”

Cagliari officials, including Giulini, chased referee Calvarese down the tunnel to ask for an explanation, but he was ushered into the locker room.

“We were lucky early on when Juve hit the post, but we stayed in the game, had several great chances and I won’t accept losing the game in this way. I won’t accept it.

However, the Rossoneri would not let the Portuguese leave unless they received €40m – €2m more than what they paid Porto last summer.

Everton recently strengthened their attack with the arrival of Cenk Tosun and could be in the market for another forward.

nter are being linked with a shock swoop for Milan defender Gabriel Paletta.

According to Quotidiano Sportivo, Paletta is one of the centre-backs that Inter are pursuing as back-up for Miranda and Milan Skriniar.
